intro: Pfaffia hookeriana, commonly known as curcuma, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine. Pfaffia hookeriana thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
